title: Incorrect library address being used
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (c78a811 2023-07-08T00:13:27.174343000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

_No response_

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

This is actually fairly serious in that the fix from here https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/5192 will silently use the wrong address for libraries if it hits a de-dupe situation.

Doing a deploy of Aave V3 Pool has the libraries mapping wrong: https://etherscan.io/address/0xc9d8b33e77c4c62e051b6174d0cbb0c1f3ea067a#code

In particular `FlashLoanLogic`, `LiquidationLogic`, `PoolLogic` and `SupplyLogic` all reference the wrong contracts and you will get EVM failures if trying to call into them. For example:

```
[2041] InitializableImmutableAdminUpgradeabilityProxy::supply(WETH9: [0xC02aaA39b223FE8D0A0e5C4F27eAD9083C756Cc2], 2000000000000000000 [2e18], SparkDeployPoolImplementation_EthereumPrimaryV302Test: [0x7FA9385bE102ac3EAc297483Dd6233D62b3e1496], 0) 
    │   ├─ [1476] 0x1757a98c1333B9dc8D408b194B2279b5AFDF70Cc::supply(WETH9: [0xC02aaA39b223FE8D0A0e5C4F27eAD9083C756Cc2], 2000000000000000000 [2e18], SparkDeployPoolImplementation_EthereumPrimaryV302Test: [0x7FA9385bE102ac3EAc297483Dd6233D62b3e1496], 0) [delegatecall]
    │   │   ├─ [238] 0x1757a98c1333B9dc8D408b194B2279b5AFDF70Cc::1913f161() [delegatecall]
    │   │   │   └─ ← ()
    │   │   └─ ← "EvmError: Revert"
    │   └─ ← "EvmError: Revert"
    └─ ← "EvmError: Revert"
```
